SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

de.systemagmbh.common.util
Class CSysStdMessage

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.common.util.CSysStdMessage
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISysMessageConvertable
public class CSysStdMessage
extends Object
implements ISysMessageConvertable

The StdMessage is for sending correct ISysMessages over the TIB-MessageBus. That is, in a StdMessage the fields CMD, ECD, ETX, MODULE, APPLICATION and LANGUAGE can be set and are always part of the reply message. There is also a StdMessage which additionally contains the fields WCD and WTX. In request messages just the fields CMD, APPLICATION and LANGUAGE are set. The message is placed in an item named CONTENTS. A StdMessage can also be rebuild from a String, if the String was build out of a StdMessage.
usage:
//---------- Building a StdMessage for request/reply:
StdMessage sm = new StdMessage("getPJobSetup", 0, "", "getSetupMethod", "PJobSrv", isysmessage);
//--- or:
StdMessage sm = new StdMessage("getPJobSetup", 0, "", "getSetupMethod", "PJobSrv", resulttable.toMessage());
//--- or:
StdMessage sm = new StdMessage("getPJobSetup", 0, "", "getSetupMethod", "PJobSrv");
//--- or:
StdMessage sm = new StdMessage("getPJobSetup", 0, "", 1, "Warning-Text", "getSetupMethod", "PJobSrv");
//--- you can also set the parameters later.
sm.setCMD("getPJobSetup");
sm.setCONTENTS(resulttable.toMessage());
//--- To get a VfeiString out of that message you have to use:
sm.toString();
//--- One can also build a VfeiMessage out of a StdMessage by using
sm.toMessage();

//----------- To get a StdMessage out of a VfeiString you can use:
String vs = new String();
StdMessage sm = new StdMessage(vs);
//--- or
ISysMessage vm = new VfeiMessage();
StdMessage sm = new StdMessage(vm);
//--- and you have access on the fields CMD, ... using the 'get' methods like
String cmd = sm.getCMD();
ISysMessage contents = getCONTENTS();

Version:
29.06.1999
Author:
Udo Friedrich
